lexUnit.name: ransack.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: rob everything of value from a source

sentence.text: They tied me up , ransacked the house and burnt our grain store .
A FRAIL old woman was battered and then left in agony for half an hour while a gang ransacked her luxury house .
After beating him , they ransacked the house , but could only find £10 's worth of coins .
At the Model school burglars ransacked the music centre after forcing open the main door .
THIEVES have ransacked the home of celebrity musician Ivy Benson , just days after she was cremated .
The men , armed with a knife and a meat cleaver , shrugged her off and ransacked the house in Saltley , Birmingham .
A TEENAGER who plunged a screwdriver into a frail 85-year-old woman as accomplices ransacked her home , has been sentenced to eight years " detention .
The attacker ransacked the house but got away with just £60 .

IRAN yesterday demanded the extradition of demonstrators who ransacked several of its embassies on Sunday , including the mission in London , and said it would claim compensation from Western governments for damage to its property .
A woman staying at a local hotel returned to find her room ransacked and another motorist had her car broken into .
The boy ransacked his father 's stores for old guns , shields and spears which we hung in the entrance hall .
From Augustus to Peter the Great , the history books were ransacked to find suitable comparisons .
THIEVES have ransacked soccer ace Paul Gascoigne 's Italian home while he was in Britain .
The residence of the Nicaraguan ambassador had been ransacked by US troops on Dec. 29 , prompting an apology from US President George Bush .
Then as Andrea , 21 , kept a bedside vigil their home in Cumberland Street , Darlington , was ransacked by thieves .
The place looks like it was ransacked by an LAPD squadron looking for drugs or a thrash metal band who found them .
The schoolhouses had been left empty in the Revolution , and then ransacked by peasants , as the Bolshevik investigators had noticed on their way to Nikol'skaia .
The RPF had agreed not to interfere with the centre 's work but in February it was ransacked by soldiers wearing Ugandan uniforms .
` Monsieur , your room has been ransacked .
One morning , someone found his potato-storage pit on the corner of his land ransacked and emptied .
The tents of the ` disobedient " were burnt down , their wives and daughters were taken into captivity , their fur stores were ransacked .
The burglary was discovered this morning when staff arrived at work to find the building had been ransacked .
Every junk-heap of the Comer on this stretch they touched at and ransacked .
